definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Now, the Hulks has got its gentleman again, through me.
sentences.chinese: 現在監獄船又經過我的手把這個正人君子請回了。

sentences.english: He's a gentleman, if you please, this villain.
sentences.chinese: 像這樣一個混蛋還裝什麼正人君子？

sentences.english: He looks as if a gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 他表面看上去是個正人君子。

sentences.english: His demeanour has always been that of a perfect gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 他的舉止始終是屬於正人君子的模樣。

sentences.english: A mensch is someone who is a refined and sensitive person.
sentences.chinese: 正人君子意味着一個人的高尚和感性。

sentences.english: He looked every inch a gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去完全是正人君子。

sentences.english: Learn boxing to Germany first, respectful humility, not competing with the recipe for an honest man.
sentences.chinese: 學拳以德爲先，恭敬謙遜，不與人爭，方爲正人君子。

sentences.english: And being the gentleman He is, I believe He has calmly backed out.
sentences.chinese: 神是正人君子，我相信祂就靜靜地站到一旁。

definition: lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person
to take advantage of sb's difficulties (idiom)
(of a widow) faithful to the death to her husband's memory
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
compassion, duty, propriety and integrity (idiom); all the traditional virtues/mainly used sarcastically, to mean hypocritical
open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
